body:
@varora02 

I am sorry, but I can't really recreate that error. Please see this snippet, maybe it will help

```python

>>> import pandas as pd
>>> df=pd.DataFrame([[1,30],[2,88],[3,93],[4,98]],columns=['no','days'])
>>> df
   no  days
0   1    30
1   2    88
2   3    93
3   4    98
>>> df[df['days']>40]
   no  days
1   2    88
2   3    93
3   4    98
>>> df.loc[df.days>75 , :]
   no  days
1   2    88
2   3    93
3   4    98
```

See http://matthewrocklin.com/blog/work/2018/02/28/minimal-bug-reports for writing minimal examples.

You probably have duplicate columns:

```python
In [7]: df = pd.DataFrame([[1, 2, 3,], [4, 5, 6]], columns=['a', 'a', 'b'])

In [8]: df.loc[df.a > 2]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-8-f7407dc680a3> in <module>()
----> 1 df.loc[df.a > 2]

~/Envs/dask-dev/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pandas/core/indexing.py in __getitem__(self, key)
   1476
   1477             maybe_callable = com._apply_if_callable(key, self.obj)
-> 1478             return self._getitem_axis(maybe_callable, axis=axis)
   1479
   1480     def _is_scalar_access(self, key):

~/Envs/dask-dev/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pandas/core/indexing.py in _getitem_axis(self, key, axis)
   1897
   1898                 if hasattr(key, 'ndim') and key.ndim > 1:
-> 1899                     raise ValueError('Cannot index with multidimensional key')
   1900
   1901                 return self._getitem_iterable(key, axis=axis)

ValueError: Cannot index with multidimensional key
```
